description: Borrowed from Middle French amnestie (Modern French amnistie), a borrowing from Latin amnestia, itself a borrowing from Ancient Greek ἀμνηστία (amnēstía).

entries.meaning: Forgetfulness; cessation of remembrance of wrong; oblivion.
An act of the sovereign power granting oblivion, or a general pardon, for a past offense, as to subjects concerned in an insurrection.

verbs.description: amnesty (third-person singular simple present amnesties, present participle amnestying, simple past and past participle amnestied)

entries.meaning: To grant a pardon (to a group)
